content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple rules but subtle game. I wish many people will join and have fun.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: That's interesting. Thank you.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Game works fine. I see no issues with it. It's also a classic boardgame. Fits well on CG.

Most abstract boardgames on codingame have the ability to place a message after your output. See for example: Yavalath or Breakthrough. The message becomes visible under your portrait.

Do you think you could put this in?
There is a minor flaw in the inputs. You should issue one string per row, not one per cell for efficiency.

- Fixed typos
- Swap pieces move ok
- Set unique size of 11x11 and 100ms per turn (first turn 1s)

Hi Alcalyn, I went through the following bug:
- I play first, I receive an empty board as input. Ok
- The opponent plays "swap-pieces".
- For my second turn, I receive again an empty board.

When I did print("xxx yyy")
The game has crashed. Please contact the author and enclose the following error:
java.util.MissingFormatArgumentException: Format specifier '%s'

You could display some custom message like in other games. But of course the referee should not crash on wrong input.

Updated:
- Spelling, 5DN1L suggestions
- board size 11 to 15 => 11 to 14
- max time per turn 100ms => 140ms
- turn input: moves history => last move + board state
Given the strong time constraints on CG, maybe you should limit the board size to 11x11. I have no definitive opinion on this.
Fine contribution. Regarding the inputs, my preference would be the usual combo, board state/last move.

Rules
* Please fix the typo: "alternatively" => "alternately".

* Please change "A stone cannot" to "Once placed, a stone cannot".

Swap move
* Please change "First player have" to "First player has".

* Please change "as follow" to "as follows".

* Please change "first player place" to "red (first player) places".

* Please change "Turn 2," to "Turn 2:".

* Please change "if blue thinks red played a too strong move" to "second player thinks first player's move is too strong".

* Please change "to stole" to "to steal".

* Please change "red first move" to "Red's first move".

* Please change "blue first move" to "blue's first move".

* Please change "i.e if played on red side, it is mirrored to go on blue side, so" to "e.g." because red always plays first.

Details
* Please capitalise the first word in 2nd and 3rd bullet points.

* Please change ", and mirror" to "to mirror".

* I don't understand why b2 becomes a1. Is my conversion below correct?
a1 => a1, a2 => b1, a3 => c1, â€¦
b1 => a2, b2 => b2, b3 => c2, â€¦
c1 => a3, c2 => b3, c3 => c3, â€¦

* Please change "count" to "counts".

Example
* Please fix the typo: "reveive" => "receive" (twice).

* Last sentence: Please change "just" to "has just".

Turn input
* Please change "integers" to "integer".

* Please change "can be" to "e.g.".

Output
* Please add "which" before "can be".

Constraints
* Please fix the typo: "alloted" => "allotted".

Story of Hex
* Please change "later" to "latter".

* Please change "find in" to "find".

Default code
* Please change "i.e." to "e.g." (twice).

Thanks.

Hi, I suggest Hex as bot programming, a very simple game which, like awale or ultimate tic tac toe, allows to focus better on our search algorithm.
It is a connection game with a high branching factor, similar to go, but with simpler rule.

Thanks! Fixed all of it!
Sorry, my native spoken language is not english obviously :)

Ok, done, turn input will looks like this:

a5
. . . . r . . r b b r . .
. r b r r r b r . b r b .
b r b r . . b b b . r b r
b b r b r . . . b r r r .
. . b r r b b r r . r b b
. b b r b . r . b . . . b
r b . b . b . b b r b b b
. . . . . r r b b . b r .
r r r r . . r r b . . . .
r r . r . b . . . b . b b
r r . . r b b r r . . b r
. b b r b r . . . b b b r
r . r . r r b b r r b b .

I saw in this contribution that the max total time is 30s: https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/16053655d4c27cf93d03a18ec3f266622ef89

At first, I set board size from 11 to 19, but limited to 15 by assuming that 15x15x100ms + 1s first turn < 24s
With a 140ms time limit, submits are going to last forever. Hence, my plea to limit the board size: shorter games, lesser combinatorial explosion

Oops, true, the error message is expected to be "Invalid move format: 'xxx yyy'. Expected e.g 'd5'.", but I mistakenly broken it.

Fixed, thanks
Oops again, yes, fixed, thanks!
I can change but I don't see the difference, the stub will just be different
Yes I see, let's do that!
done

Cool, my bot now says win when it solved.  It's only a depth 1 search. I use:

- Kirchhoff electrical circuit eval (extremely expensive, can only do like 200 of them in 100 ms)

- Virtual connections (you can easily tell from my games) that count any two groups that share 2 empty neighbors as a connected group.

I'm trying to use more math for virtual connections, maybe some patterns to detect early wins and pruning for inferior hexes. 

https://www.codingame.com/replay/812365214
My bad, changing the stub does the job. Your protocol is OK.
Ok... I gave up the idea of dynamic board size, and set a fixed size of 11x11. Set max turn time back to 100ms
Good catch although my concern was mostly on the limited thinking time combined to a high branching factor
I see, you mean on 15x15, 100ms would produce maybe too random results, even with an optimized mcts implemented in C ?
Yes. Writing a fast 11x11 engine is doable, bigger sizes cannot be optimized the same way because of the board footprint.

Oh... I like the fact we can play on multiple sizes. Maybe I can try limit to 14, and give 140ms per turn.

When going deeper in game strategy, we know how to elagate lot of moves (dead cells, inferior cells)

You're welcome ðŸ˜‰

Just three more changes:

Swap move
* Please change "second player" to "blue (second player)".

Turn input
* Please change:
"empty" if no move played yet, "d4", "swap-pieces", ...
to:
<const>empty</const> if no move played yet, or cell coordinates like <action>d4</action>, or <action>swap-pieces</action>

Output
* Please change "coords" to "coordinates".

Thanks.
Thanks again, done

There may be some misunderstanding of my last commentâ€¦

Turn input
* Please change:

<action>d4</action>, <action>swap-pieces</action>, ...

to:

or cell coordinates like <action>d4</action>, or <action>swap-pieces</action>

Thanks.
I see, thx, fixed
